intro: Coccoloba yucatana, commonly known as the Yucatan beautyberry, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and Central America. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows up to 3 meters in height. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by red, fleshy berries. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a distinctive waxy coating. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas and disturbed sites.
